messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2433
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/3/02 7:35:04 PM, kbcdlovejo@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/3/02 7:35:04 PM, kbcdlovejo@... writes:

<< Maybe why toddlers and teens NEED so much sleep? They're growing. You need
to
sleep when the bones are lengthening? >>

Yes. That's always what I've heard even when I was a kid in school (and they
woke me up at 6:30 from a deep sleep to get READY for school... maybe I
would have been taller).

Sandra

messages.subject: Yurts & Bells
messages.msgSnippet: ... == Well of course. And then send us pictures of the finished product (w/you in it, of course :) Todd ... Despite the high cost of living it s still
messages.messageBody:
At 06:38 AM 10/5/02 -0700, Elissa Cleaveland wrote:

>We've decided on aYurt and a more solid house in Five years.
>Well, I'm off to dye some silk for a skirt. Should I sew bells along the hem?
==
Well of course.<g> And then send us pictures of the finished product (w/you
in it, of course :)

Todd

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Yurts
messages.msgSnippet: Well, I must be a grown up now. We ve decided on a Yurt and a more solid house in Five years. Well, I m off to dye some silk for a skirt. Should I sew bells
messages.messageBody:
Well, I must be a grown up now. We've decided on a
Yurt and a more solid house in Five years.
Well, I'm off to dye some silk for a skirt. Should I
sew bells along the hem?
Elissa Jill, the soon to be yurt living hippy - Oy
Gut, my bubbe would be proud.

I'm never growing up. I'm having too much fun! :)
But I think yurts look pretty cool, too.

brenda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2433
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/3/2002 5:25:50 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Maybe why toddlers and teens NEED so much sleep? They re growing. You need to sleep when the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/3/2002 5:25:50 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> Asleep makes more sense. I didn't really give it any thought at the time (it
>
> was just a few weeks ago). I kind of looked at him quizzically and he
> muttered something about more growth hormone being secreted then and I
> didn't
> question him further -- you know how doctors' appts are -- not a lot of
> chat
> time <G>.
>
>

Maybe why toddlers and teens NEED so much sleep? They're growing. You need to
sleep when the bones are lengthening?

Kelly
